title: NASA warns of budget challenges in year ahead
summary: Despite its successes last year, the leadership of NASA warns that the coming year could be more challenging as it fights to preserve its budget on Capitol Hill.

title: The future of Starship includes national security missions
summary: As SpaceX prepares to attempt Starship’s first orbital flight, the company is contemplating military applications for the super-heavy launch vehicle.

title: China’s LEO push looms over Western expansion efforts
summary: Ambitious plans from China for a global broadband network could hamper Western constellation operators seeking to maximize their international subscriber numbers.

title: NASA Experts Go on Tour with The Color of Space Documentary
summary: NASA and Blue Origin’s Club for the Future will co-host multiple free in-person viewing events of the agency’s documentary, The Color of Space, at historically Black colleges and universities, conferences, festivals, and more nationwide. The documentary is a conversation between seven current and former Black astronauts, each of whom were selected

title: NASA Virtual Aviation Showcase to Highlight Transformative Innovation
summary: Members of the media and public are invited to participate in NASA’s imaginAviation, a free, virtual event focusing on how the agency transforms research innovations into new possibilities for aviation for the benefit of humanity. Sessions run from Tuesday, Feb. 28, to Thursday, March 2.

title: Delving Deeper: Super Heavy thrust and counting down to flight
summary: The orbital test flight of Starship is just around the corner.

title: Terran Orbital announces $2.4 billion Rivada Space Networks contract
summary: SAN FRANCISCO — Terran Orbital Corporation announced a $2.4 billion contract to build 300 satellites for Rivada Space Networks. Under the contract announced Feb. 22, Terran Orbital will design, build and deploy 288 satellites in low-Earth orbit. In addition, Terran Orbital will build 12 satellite spares. “I think this is the largest smallsat contract ever […]

title: SpaceX adjusts Starlink monthly pricing for residential customers based on service capacity
summary: Elon Musk’s SpaceX rolled out new pricing for residential Starlink customers based on its capacity to deliver service, according to emails to customers reviewed by CNBC.

title: Capella teams with analytics firms to promote use of radar imagery
summary: ORLANDO — Capella Space, a company that operates a constellation of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imaging satellites, is partnering with data analytics firms to help increase access to SAR imagery, the company announced Feb. 22. SAR is a specialized form of remote sensing that has seen growing demand as SAR satellites can capture images at […]

title: Terran Orbital surges 71% after winning $2.4 billion contract to build satellites for Rivada
summary: Terran Orbital shares surged on Wednesday after the company announced a $2.4 billion contract to build communications satellites for Rivada Space Networks.
